'Calcein', also known as 'fluorexon, [[fluorescein]] complex', is a fluorescent
dye with an excitation and emission wavelengths of 495/515 nm,
respectively. Calcein also self-quenches even at concentrations below
100mM. Patel et al. Characterizing vesicle leakage by ï¬uorescence lifetime
measurements  It is used as a complexometric indicator for titration of
calcium ions with EDTA, and for fluorometric determination of calcium. It has
the appearance of orange crystals.
